newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares end firmer, small-caps take lead.
newsitem.headline: KL shares end firmer, small-caps take lead.

text.p: Year-end buying lifted Kuala Lumpur share prices to a higher finish, with small-capitalised issues taking the lead on renewed retail interest.
But, mirroring the slow holiday trading of last week, activity remained muted, dealers said. "All in all, it's very, very quiet," said Audrey Ho, head of research at Mohaiyani Securities.
The Composite Index of blue chips rose 5.69 points to 1,214.69, a 0.47 percent gain. The Second Board index added 11.92 points or 2.11 percent to 575.63.
Gains among the main-liner stocks were focused on a few names including United Engineers, Genting and Commerce Asset, dealers said.
"Tomorrow, there's a possibility of window-dressing which normally is confined to index-linked stocks," said an equity analyst at a local research house.

On the Kuala Lumpur Options and Financial Futures Exchange, the spot December contract was up 13.0 points to 1,213.0 on volume of 200 lots, while the January futures contract was up 13.5 to 1,221.0 with 166 lots traded.
